availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Sylvanus Clark Bascom, Jr. (Bath County, Kentucky, student and clerk)

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, student and clerk. Kentucky native. Son of Sylvanus Clark Bascom, Sr. and Mary Nicholas Owings Bascom. Attended school in Bath County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned three enslaved persons in Bath County in 1850. Clerk in Bath County in 1860. Household owned two enslaved persons in Bath County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, District 2, p. 2B.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Owingsville, p. 74A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Owingsville, p. 68B.
Lineage Book of the Charter Members of the National Society of the Daughters of the American Revolution, eds. Mary S. Lockwood and Susan Riviere Hetzel (Washington, D. C.: National Society of the Daughters of the American Revolution, 1891-1939) vol. 159: 1920, p. 156.
